com.tsgrp.migration.node.content

Class BasicContent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tsgrp.migration.node.content.BasicContent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Content

    public class BasicContent
extends java.lang.Object
implements Content
    Define a piece of "content", which each MigrationNode has exactly one of.

    The content is put into the node at some point by the Source (or one of its Listeners), which is responsible for creating the actual instance, configuring it, loading the actual underlying content, and placing it into the Node.

    Downstream, the Target can always just "blindly" get the content out as a Stream or File; but it can also query the Content object in order to more "intelligently" make use of the internal representation of the content. However, each implementation of the Content object MUST support both query methods, although other operations (e.g., cleanup) may be no-ops.

    In general, this class's methods re-throw the underlying checked exception, with the assumption that the calling ContentReader will want to handle them appropriately.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BasicContent()
      Use default settings for tempFilePrefix, Suffix and Directory.
      BasicContent(java.lang.String tempFilePrefix, java.lang.String tempFileSuffix, java.io.File tempFileDirectory)
      Construct a BasicContentNode with the given tempFilePrefix, Suffix and Directory, which are passed to File.createTempFile(String, String, File) when a temp file is needed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanup()
      Free any resources (e.g., temporary files or internal streams) in use by the content; called when the node's processing is completed, usually by the Target at the end of its work.
      java.io.File getFile()
      Regardless of the underlying storage of the content (memory or file) or how it was passed in (memory or file), return a File object pointing to the content.
      long getSize()
      If content has been set (even if it's zero-length), return the length in bytes; else, -1.

      Regardless of the underlying storage of the content (memory or file) or how it was passed in (memory or file), return an Input stream wrapping the actual content.

      If content has been set into this object (even if it's zero-length), return true.
      boolean isFileOriginal()
      If content was populated from an "original" file (using Content.setContent(File, boolean) with #isInFileTemporary = false), return true.
      boolean isStoredInFile()
      Return true if the content is stored in memory (whether it is ONLY in memory or has also been written to a file).

      Return true if the content is stored in memory (whether it is ONLY in memory or has also been written to a file).

      Set the underlying content from the given File, as a simple pointer back to the file specified.

      Set the underlying content from the given InputStream, either in memory or in a temp file.

        Length of content, in bytes; set in one of the setContent methods.

      • holdingStream

        protected org.apache.commons.io.output.DeferredFileOutputStream holdingStream
        Holds the underlying bytes/temp file when content set as a InputStream in setContent(InputStream, int).

      • inFile

        protected java.io.File inFile
        Holds the pointer to the file sent in to setContent(File, boolean).

      • isInFileTemporary

        protected boolean isInFileTemporary
        When a file is provided, caller can indicate that we can delete it when we're done with it.

      • tempFilePrefix

        protected java.lang.String tempFilePrefix
        When we need to create a temp file, use this prefix. Set in constructor and immutable thereafter.

      • tempFileSuffix

        protected java.lang.String tempFileSuffix
        When we need to create a temp file, use this suffix (default to .tmp if null). Set in constructor and immutable thereafter.

      • tempFileDirectory

        protected java.io.File tempFileDirectory
        When we need to create a temp file, send this directory to File.createTempFile(String, String, File). If left null, system default (java.io.tmpdir, usually /tmp or /var/tmp or C:/Temp) is used. Set in constructor and immutable thereafter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicContent

        public BasicContent()
        Use default settings for tempFilePrefix, Suffix and Directory.

      • BasicContent

        public BasicContent(java.lang.String tempFilePrefix,
                    java.lang.String tempFileSuffix,
                    java.io.File tempFileDirectory)
        Construct a BasicContentNode with the given tempFilePrefix, Suffix and Directory, which are passed to File.createTempFile(String, String, File) when a temp file is needed.
        Parameters:
        tempFilePrefix - - required, at least 3 characters
        tempFileSuffix - - if null, ".tmp" is used.
        tempFileDirectory - - if null, java.io.tmpdir is used; otherwise, must exist
        Throws:
        ContentException - if prefix or directory is invalid

      • setContent

        public void setContent(java.io.InputStream inStream,
                       int inMemoryThreshold)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Content
        Set the underlying content from the given InputStream, either in memory or in a temp file. If the content is smaller than the threshold, its bytes will be kept in memory; otherwise, written to a temp file.
        Specified by:
        setContent in interface Content
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the copy to the holding stream or closing the input stream fails
        See Also:
        Content.setContent(java.io.InputStream, int)

      • setContent

        public void setContent(java.io.File inFile,
                       boolean isInFileTemporary)
        Description copied from interface: Content
        Set the underlying content from the given File, as a simple pointer back to the file specified. The caller can indicated that isInFileTemporary is true, meaning that it has first created this file just to send to us but that it is truly temporary and should be deleted when we're done with it in the Content.cleanup().
        Specified by:
        setContent in interface Content
        See Also:
        Content.setContent(java.io.File, boolean)

      • getFile

        public java.io.File getFile()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            ContentException
        Description copied from interface: Content
        Regardless of the underlying storage of the content (memory or file) or how it was passed in (memory or file), return a File object pointing to the content. This may be the original file, or a temporary file, so callers should take care not to modify the returned file (only read it).
        Specified by:
        getFile in interface Content
        Returns:
        File
        Throws:

        ContentException - if content has not yet been set
        See Also:
